slokas: अर्जुन उवाचये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विता: ।तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तम: ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: O Krishna, what is the position of those who disregard the injunctions of the scriptures but worship with faith? Is it goodness, passion, or ignorance?

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचत्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा ।सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां श‍ृणु ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: According to the modes of nature acquired by the embodied soul, one's faith can be of three kinds—goodness, passion, or ignorance. Now hear about these.

slokas: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत ।श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्ध: स एव स: ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: According to one's nature, one's faith is developed, O Arjuna. The human being is made up of faith; whatever one's faith is, one is that.

slokas: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसा: ।प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जना: ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: The virtuous worship the gods; the passionate worship the demons and spirits; the ignorant worship the ghosts and the dead.

slokas: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जना: ।दम्भाहङ्कारसंयुक्ता: कामरागबलान्विता: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: People who perform severe austerities not enjoined by the scriptures, and who are full of hypocrisy, pride, and arrogance, and are possessed by lust and attachment.

slokas: कर्षयन्त: शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतस: ।मां चैवान्त: शरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who torment the embodied living beings, are tormented by me. Know this for certain.

slokas: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रिय: ।यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं श‍ृणु ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: Even food is of three kinds, so are sacrifice, penance, and charity. Hear thou the distinction of these.

slokas: आयु:सत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धना: ।रस्या: स्‍निग्धा: स्थिरा हृद्या आहारा: सात्त्विकप्रिया: ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: Foods that increase life, purify one's existence, give strength, health, happiness, and satisfaction, which are juicy, fatty, wholesome, and pleasing to the heart, are dear to those in the mode of goodness.

slokas: कट्‌वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिन: ।आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दु:खशोकामयप्रदा: ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Foods that are too bitter, too sour, salty, hot, pungent, dry, and burning are dear to those in the mode of passion and cause distress, misery, and disease.

slokas: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् ।उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: Food that is stale, tasteless, putrid, rotten and impure is dear to those in the mode of ignorance.

slokas: अफलाकाङ्‌‍क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदिष्टो य इज्यते ।यष्टव्यमेवेति मन: समाधाय स सात्त्विक: ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: The sacrifice that is offered by those who desire no reward, in accordance with the scriptural injunctions, with a mind fixed on the idea that it is a duty to perform, is of the quality of goodness.

slokas: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् ।इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Establishing a sacrifice for ostentation, know that to be Rajasic, O best of the Bharatas.

slokas: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्‍त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् ।श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: Sacrifice devoid of scriptural injunctions, devoid of offering, devoid of faith, and devoid of food offerings, is declared to be in the mode of ignorance.

slokas: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् ।ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: Worship of gods, twice-born, teachers, and wise persons, cleanliness, straightforwardness, celibacy, and non-violence are said to be the austerities of the body.

slokas: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् ।स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्‍मयं तप उच्यते ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: A speech that is not agitating, truthful, pleasant, and beneficial, as well as the habitual study of scriptures, is called verbal austerity.

slokas: मन:प्रसाद: सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रह: ।भावसंश‍ुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: Tranquility of mind, gentleness, silence, self-restraint, and purity of thought are called the austerity of the mind.

slokas: श्रद्धया परया तप्‍तं तपस्तत्‍त्रिविधं नरै: ।अफलाकाङ्‌‍क्षिभिर्युक्तै: सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: Men perform three kinds of austerities with the highest faith. Those who seek no reward for their actions are said to be of sattvic temperament.

slokas: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् ।क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: Respect, honor, and worship are performed here for the sake of show and ostentation; this is declared to be Rajasic, unstable, and impermanent.

slokas: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तप: ।परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: When penance is performed with foolish obstinacy, or to harm others, it is declared to be tamasic.

slokas: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे ।देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: The giving which is done as a duty, in a fit place, to a worthy person, at a proper time, is regarded as Sattvic charity.

slokas: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुन: ।दीयते च परिक्ल‍ि‍ष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: But that gift which is given to one who expects something in return, or with a grudge, is said to be Rajasic.

slokas: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते ।असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: When charity is given at the wrong time and place, to unworthy recipients, it is declared to be of the nature of darkness.

slokas: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविध: स्मृत: ।ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिता: पुरा ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: Om, Tat, Sat - these three words indicate the Supreme. They have been used in the past for the Brahman, the Vedas, and the sacrifices.

slokas: तस्माद् ॐ इत्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतप:क्रिया: ।प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ता: सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Therefore, constantly performing the prescribed duties of sacrifice, charity, and austerity, as mentioned in the scriptures, the followers of the Vedas begin their actions by uttering "Om".

slokas: तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतप:क्रिया: ।दानक्रियाश्च विविधा: क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्‌‍क्षिभि: ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: Having fixed their minds on that, the fruits of sacrifices and austerities, as also various acts of charity, are performed by those desiring liberation.

slokas: सद्भ‍ावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते ।प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्द: पार्थ युज्यते ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: In goodness and in virtue, O Arjuna, this word "sat" is used. In a laudable action also, the word "sat" is used.

slokas: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थिति: सदिति चोच्यते ।कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: In sacrifice, penance, and charity, the word 'Sattva' is used; and also, the word 'Sattva' is used in reference to action.

slokas: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्‍तं कृतं च यत् ।असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: Offered with faith, food sanctified by austerity gives eternal benefit. Disregarded as impure by those who lack faith, such food does not purify either in this world or the next.
